political_highlights.description: Total usable reserves forecast to fall from £26.1M to £8.8M by March 2026 — a 66% drop in two years as capital programme accelerates
Hyndburn Leisure Trust requiring £700K additional support due to utility costs, minimum wage and National Insurance increases
Corporate Savings Target of £163,900 (0.94% of spend) reintroduced to balance the budget
49% of funding comes from Business Rates — Hyndburn is the most BR-dependent council in East Lancashire
New statutory Food Waste collection from April 2026 — DEFRA grant expected but revenue funding uncertain
£400K additional Housing Benefit costs from 'exempt properties' claims the Council cannot recover
Central Government funding still £4.3M lower than 2010/11 levels despite new Recovery Grant
£24M Accrington Town Centre regeneration via Levelling Up Fund — biggest capital investment in council history
